instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
Diode mode <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.0016V

5V 0A from charger.
Both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> LDO outputs got correct diode mode readings.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V (0.400V in diode mode)

Where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
Post exact ohm value for the short.
It is probably 2-3 ohm, low enough to heat something with 3-4V max.
Start with 1V and go high slowly, if needed; no more than 4V.
Do not forget to remove CPU heatsink.

Should be better to remove first <RESISTOR>R6999</RESISTOR> and see where the short remains.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6999</RESISTOR> removed.

<RESISTOR>R6999</RESISTOR>/1 resistance 21Ohm, 0.013V in diode mode
<RESISTOR>R6999</RESISTOR>/2 0.500V in diode mode

Because is not 2-3 ohm is still fine to inject voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
No need to inject voltage now; as the low value remains on the left side.
Lift L6995, to discard between <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>, or one of the 6x10uF caps...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
One of the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> was getting warm.
Replaced <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> and all works fine.

Mega thank you for all details you always giving me in every thread - thats helps me a lot to understand how those boards works :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?
threads.message: You're welcome, glad to hear is solved.
